document_title: Purulent tonsillitis: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_content:
Patients have some of the following typical symptoms:
Hoarseness or loss of voice;; Dry cough or cough with phlegm;; Sore throat, sore throat;; There may or may not be symptoms of fever;; There is phlegm stuck in the throat, making it difficult to spit or swallow;; Occasionally when you cough or sneeze, you will see small white speckled particles with a foul smell.(2)
Dry cough and cough with phlegm are common symptoms
